alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 5:35PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 615 PM MST... At 534 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Apache Junction to near Florence Junction to 10 miles southwest of Boyce Thompson Arboretum. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, Queen Creek, Gold Camp, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Seville, Florence Junction, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph, Blackwater, Chandler Heights and Gilbert City Hall. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 191 and 214. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 128 and 168. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 31 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MST for south central and southeastern Arizona.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior
